intro: Guzmania calamifolia, commonly known as the red-tipped peace lily, is a striking bromeliad native to the tropical rainforests of South America. It is characterized by its vibrant, red-tipped leaves that contrast beautifully with its dark green foliage. The plant produces a long, spathaceous flower that resembles a peace lily, though it is not related to the true peace lily genus. It thrives in bright, indirect light and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Guzmania calamifolia is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively low maintenance requirements.
